title: Separable Layers Enable Structured Efficient Linear Substitutions
abstract:
In response to the development of recent efficient dense layers, this paper
shows that something as simple as replacing linear components in pointwise
convolutions with structured linear decompositions also produces substantial
gains in the efficiency/accuracy tradeoff. Pointwise convolutions are fully
connected layers and are thus prepared for replacement by structured
transforms. Networks using such layers are able to learn the same tasks as
those using standard convolutions, and provide Pareto-optimal benefits in
efficiency/accuracy, both in terms of computation (mult-adds) and parameter
count (and hence memory). Code is available at
https://github.com/BayesWatch/deficient-efficient.
